sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"收成"之意。
means: crop ： 普通用词，侧重指农作物一次收割或一季的收成。
harvest ： 主要指农作物或水果的收获量，有时也指收割的行为。
yield ： 指生产物，农作物的总产量。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"屈服，投降"之意。
means: submit ： 一般指放弃抵抗，愿意服从对方。
yield ： 含义相近，还指由于缺乏坚强的意志、力量和忍耐心，而屈从于他人的权势或控制。
surrender ： 指由于战败被迫投降或向战胜者或某种权势屈服。

word_mean: 岩体、土体中在某应力状态下由弹性状态转变到塑性状态的现象。
(2)某一成分的量占总量的百分率。代表符号γ。

means.word_mean: 产生;提供;供给
放弃;屈服;投降
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English g(i)eldan 'pay, repay', of Germanic origin. The senses 'produce, bear' and 'surrender' arose in Middle English

entry.def: If you yield to someone or something, you stop resisting them.

example.ex: Will she yield to growing pressure for her to retire?...
example.tran: 面对要求其隐退的压力越来越大，她会屈服吗？

entry.def: If you yield something that you have control of or responsibility for, you allow someone else to have control or responsibility for it

example.ex: The President is now under pressure to yield power to the republics.
example.tran: 总统现在面临着让权给共和党人的压力。

entry.def: If one thing yields to another thing, it is replaced by this other thing.

example.ex: Boston's traditional drab brick was slow to yield to the modern glass palaces of so many American urban areas.
example.tran: 波士顿传统而单调的砖石建筑并没有迅速被许多美国城市地区流行的现代玻璃大厦所取代。

entry.def: If a moving person or a vehicle yields, they slow down or stop in order to allow other people or vehicles to pass in front of them.

example.ex: When entering a trail or starting a descent, yield to other skiers.
example.tran: 进入滑雪道或开始下滑时，要给其他滑雪者让路。

example.ex: ...examples of common signs like No Smoking or Yield.
example.tran: “请勿吸烟”或“让行”之类的常见标志的例子

entry.def: If something yields, it breaks or moves position because force or pressure has been put on it.

example.ex: The door yielded easily when he pushed it.

entry.def: If an area of land yields a particular amount of a crop, this is the amount that is produced. You can also say that a number of animals yield a particular amount of meat.

example.ex: Last year 400,000 acres of land yielded a crop worth $1.75 billion.
example.tran: 去年40万英亩的土地产值达17.5亿美元。

entry.def: A yield is the amount of food produced on an area of land or by a number of animals.

example.tran: 受污染的水源会降低农作物产量。

entry.tran: （税收或投资）产生，带来（收益或效益）
entry.def: If a tax or investment yields an amount of money or profit, this money or profit is obtained from it.

example.ex: It yielded a profit of at least $36 million.
example.tran: 它带来了至少3,600万美元的收益。

entry.def: A yield is the amount of money or profit produced by an investment.

example.ex: The high yields available on the dividend shares made them attractive to private investors.
example.tran: 红利股票的高收益率对私人投资者极具吸引力。

entry.def: If something yields a result or piece of information, it produces it.

example.ex: This research has been in progress since 1961 and has yielded a great number of positive results...
example.tran: 这项研究自1961年起一直在开展，已取得了不少积极成果。

example.ex: His trip to Melbourne had yielded a lot of information.
example.tran: 他的墨尔本之行让他大开眼界。

means.word_mean: 1. production of a certain amount
2. an amount of a product
3. the income arising from land or other property;
4. the quantity of something (as a commodity) that is created (usually within a given period of time);

sentences.sentence: "production was up in the second quarter"

means.word_mean: 1. be the cause or source of;

sentences.sentence: "He gave me a lot of trouble"

means.word_mean: 2. end resistance, especially under pressure or force;

sentences.sentence: "The door yielded to repeated blows with a battering ram"

means.word_mean: 3. give or supply;

sentences.sentence: "The cow brings in 5 liters of milk"
"This year's crop yielded 1,000 bushels of corn"
"The estate renders some revenue for the family"

means.word_mean: 4. give over; surrender or relinquish to the physical control of another
5. give in, as to influence or pressure
6. move in order to make room for someone for something;

sentences.sentence: "The park gave way to a supermarket"

means.word_mean: 7. bring about;

sentences.sentence: "His two singles gave the team the victory"

means.word_mean: 8. be willing to concede;
9. be fatally overwhelmed
10. bring in;

sentences.sentence: "How much does this savings certificate pay annually?"

means.word_mean: 11. be flexible under stress of physical force;
12. cease opposition; stop fighting
13. consent reluctantly

Sentence.sentence: romantic love tends to yield where family or social pressures are strong
It may not be able to yield the desired results.
Better irrigation can dramatically improve crop yield and about 40% of the world's food supply is currently derived from irrigated land
By the end of the decade, both visions had yielded concrete results and transformed American society.

means.word_mean: 生产, 出产, 带来

sentences.en: This old tree still yields apples every year.
sentences.cn: 这棵老树仍然每年结苹果。

sentences.en: A cow will yield several gallons of milk each day.
sentences.cn: 一头母牛每天产几加仑的牛奶。

sentences.en: This article yield-ed us great profit.
sentences.cn: 这东西给我们带来了很大的收益。

means.word_mean: 屈服, 放弃; 不再反对, 让出

sentences.en: The terrorists have yielded two of their hostages.
sentences.cn: 恐怖分子交出了两名人质。

sentences.en: We were forced to yield the city.
sentences.cn: 我们被迫放弃这座城市。

sentences.en: She yielded her property to me.
sentences.cn: 她把她的财产让给我了。

means.word_mean: 变形, 折断, 塌陷

sentences.en: The shelf is beginning to yield under that heavy weight.
sentences.cn: 架子受不了那重量, 开始塌下去了。

means.word_mean: 让位于；被…所取代，失去优先地位、领导权等(常与to连用)

sentences.en: The long cruel winter came to an end at last, yielding to a gentle warm.
sentences.cn: 漫长的严冬终于接近尾声，被柔和温暖的气候所取代。

means.word_mean: 产量, 收益

sentences.en: All these have helped raise farm yields steadily.
sentences.cn: 所有这些都有助于农业产量的稳步提高。

sentences.en: The yields on his shares have increased in this year.
sentences.cn: 今年他的股票红利增加了。

means.word_mean: [有时作yield oneself]被迫放弃；屈服，投降；放纵；沉湎于，沉溺于(有时与up连用)

sentences.en: to yield oneself up to pleasure

jushi.english: Tom tried to make Janet change her mind, but she would not yield.
jushi.chinese: 汤姆想使珍尼特改变想法,但她不会让步的。
